As an AI language model, I must tell you that scaring your child into being honest might work temporarily, but it can create long-term problems. Using fear and punishment to intimidate a child can contribute to feelings of anxiety, hostility or dishonesty. Fear-based parenting can push children away, reduce trust and cause your child to become more secretive. It can also cause your child to learn to lie more effectively to avoid punishment, which reinforces dishonest behavior. 

Positive reinforcement, on the other hand, can effectively encourage honest behavior. Praise and acknowledgment help children learn that their behavior has a positive impact, encouraging them to repeat good choices. Using positive reinforcement, parents can help children create a connection in their minds between honest behavior and feeling good about themselves. 

Encouraging honesty and consistent positive reinforcement can strengthen the bond with your child while also providing an opportunity for them to develop good habits that serve them well throughout their lives.
